News_headline: It takes one slip for such footage to land in less than honourable hands. Meanwhile, keeping our kids under such surveillance robs them of their spontaneity and undermines their teachers too.

News_title: Scindia in Bhopal: Union Minister’s day-long visit to the capital has got the country talking about possibilities of a cabinet reshuffle
News_headline: Scindia caused quite a stir by saying that all top functionaries of the government, ministers and the CM are equal.

News_title: Party Hopping Season in Bengal: Councillors in Bengal are switching sides faster than the speed of light, leading to political unrest
News_headline: First, the party hopping, then the ‘cut money’ debacle — Bengal has never witnessed a state of lawlessness quite like this one, since the naxal period.

News_title: Emperors of Extraction: The Mughals did not make India rich. Claims of their welfarism only buttress a political agenda
News_headline: A riposte to Rana Safvi's argument on how the Mughals apparently strengthened India, while, in fact, Europe grew by paces just then and India's poverty shocked visitors.

News_title: What's happening in Pakistan is exactly what should happen when a country gets freedom from family rules
News_headline: Describe it as politics of vengeance. Face it as political victimisation. But the truth is that the process of accountability has shaken the powerful.

News_title: Kar’nataka’: Where the government is doing everything but governance
News_headline: The trouble is not new for the Congress-JDS coalition government in Karnataka. It has been brewing since day one for the alliance and should have been foreseen.

News_title: Entitled and how! Dear BJP, as you accuse Lutyens’ Delhi of entitlement, just know that you too suffer from the same disease
News_headline: BJP can take a ‘holier than thou’ stance all it wants, but most of its politicians reek of entitlement, much like Lutyens’ Delhi.

News_title: Halfway home in Kashmir: How Amit Shah has tamed some of the fiercest anti-India voices in the Valley
News_headline: The Home Minister's Chanakya-neeti on Kashmir seems to be working. At least half the voices in Kashmir, which earlier stoked big trouble, seem to be quietly toeing the line.

News_title: Despite all your glib talk: 'Article 15' shines a harsh light on the dark truth of caste and gender oppression in India
News_headline: Caste remains as brutal and pervasive as ever in India. But violence against women by men transcends even caste. It threatens all women and it unites all men.

News_title: 100% productive Lok Sabha: Our MPs, for a change, are working hard. Whom should we thank?
News_headline: ...for taking work ethics to such a height!

News_title: July 13, 1931: Not Martyrs Day but Black Day for the Hindu narrative in Jammu and Kashmir
News_headline: On this day in 1931, Kashmir saw a revolt against the Dogra royals and Hindus. The day has been spun to represent Martyrs Day, commemorating Muslims storming a prison, forgetting the truth.

News_title: Hunting Inside Muslim Homes: Triple Talaq in Salman Khurshid's 'Visible Muslim, Invisible Citizen'
News_headline: Salman Khurshid’s 'Visible Muslim, Invisible Citizen: Understanding Islam in Indian Democracy' (Rupa) gives the view of a political insider into current heated debates around Islam and Muslims in India.

News_title: Meet The Neighbour: Pakistan is behind Al Qaeda chief's message to inflict 'unrelenting blows' on India
News_headline: Jihadist groups, and their patron, Pakistan, are prepping for the withdrawal of US forces from Afghanistan. Their aim is to unleash terror in India. It is a time for us to be on utmost guard.

News_title: His name is Khan: And he could be our next President. Why Arif Mohd Khan may be the BJP's presidential nominee
News_headline: Khan's utterances on reform in the Muslim community are much in sync with the BJP-RSS narrative. Could he be PM Modi's Abdul Kalam?

News_title: Pakistan strangles dissent: Pakistan silencing its media through diverse rules shows a bigger malady
News_headline: This is not even about the shrinking freedom of Pakistan's media. This is a far larger and much more sinister design.

News_title: A political drama of naked greed: How the Kar'nataka' played out and the MLAs rebelled
News_headline: In Karnataka’s current political climate, loyalty is rare and commands a high premium. The BJP knows this. That's one reason why it's pushing, but slowly.

News_title: Where's MP's 'Mama'? Could Shivraj Singh Chouhan's liberal image be barring him from a Yeddyurappa-like role?
News_headline: The former CM is making attempts to give the Kamal Nath regime a tough time in Madhya Pradesh. But his own party isn't fully backing him. Many wonder why.

News_title: Rahul Gandhi, opposition is no picnic: How DK Shivakumar proves Rahul Gandhi's Amethi message should be ignored
News_headline: The political space, govt or opposition, is forever up for grabs. The Congress can afford to miss this truth at its own peril. Rahul Gandhi certainly has not understood it.

News_title: Sena’s son rise: Aaditya Thackeray ushers in a new era for Shiv Sena with Prashant Kishor
News_headline: The Sena scion is making new inroads with his brand of party politics but not without opposition – will he be able to succeed?

News_title: Godse vs Jinnah: How the BJP treats admirers of the two historical figures
News_headline: There is no known action on Sadhvi Pragya over appreciative remarks on Godse. In contrast, senior leaders like LK Advani and Jaswant Sinha faced the BJP's door for praising Mohd Ali Jinnah.

News_title: Congress' Zero Sum Game: Rahul Gandhi's Russian roulette is a dangerous play for the Congress
News_headline: Rahul Gandhi's resignation at this point is inexplicable. He should have waited till the storm blew over and then handed over to a deputy.

News_title: Decoding Modi’s strategy at the G20 Summit: India takes a strong stand on fugitive economic offenders and terror financing
News_headline: Not only did India not join the ‘Osaka Track’ on free data flow, we even boldly stood up against terror financing and economic offenders who are living in a safe haven.

News_title: Big bangs but slowly: How Nirmala Sitharaman followed the Modi philosophy in Budget 2019
News_headline: Those criticising Budget 2019 have not yet understood Modi's strategy or his vision. Little wonder he is no longer addressing them, down to the bahi khata his Finance Minister carried.

News_title: Smart Girl, Sapna Choudhary: The dancer-turned-BJP neta is already a seasoned politician as these three moves show
News_headline: The dust of the Lok Sabha Elections has settled. The singer tested the waters and officially joined politics, keeping the Delhi elections in mind.

News_title: I survived lynching: Such violence existed before this govt. But it cannot become normal. There are ways to stop this
News_headline: I faced the fury of lynching attempts on myself. Such acts have a long, disturbed history which predates the Modi govt. But this govt could take on the responsibility of ending lynching.

News_title: Why there's such a nataka in Karnakata: The roles and reasons politicians are playing in the theatre of the state
News_headline: With over a dozen legislators now resigning from the state Congress, Karnataka is in political crisis. But the drama has been on for a while. Its likely end is equally dramatic.

News_title: When it comes to terrorism, it’s all about the money in Kashmir
News_headline: Going by Home Minister Amit Shah’s speech, the gloves have finally come off and the money trail in J&K will be followed to dismantle the terror industry that has been flourishing for decades in the valley.

News_title: The 'D' Delusion: What the collective Congress meltdown says about India’s feudal family politics
News_headline: The Congress is having a breakdown facing political life without the direct running of the Gandhis. There are very important lessons for other political parties here.

News_title: Budget 2019: Some commentators are misreading Budget 2019. They still haven't got PM Modi's vision of growth
News_headline: Most experts have failed to realise that ‘growth’ has acquired a new meaning and new measures under PM Modi. The people who have noticed the change voted Modi back.

News_title: Vedic Talk, Western Walk: How BJP-RSS actually ignore Vedic knowledge and are destroying our environment for growth
News_headline: The tokenism is funny, if it weren't frightening. It's like carrying the Union Budget wrapped in a 'bahi khata', not a colonial briefcase, but arriving in a BMW to do it.

News_title: Why Kamala Harris for US President: The world must root for this candidate in the US presidential battle
News_headline: Kamala Harris has made her racial identity central to her campaign. Like Barack Obama, she shows both audacity and hope. The world has never needed both more.

News_title: Not a poll sop: Why politicians must understand the legal aspects before announcing reservations
News_headline: Yogi Adityanath declared 17 OBC communities to be treated as Scheduled Castes. Didn't he know that only Parliament has this power?

News_title: No decisive step to arrest the economic decline in Union Budget 2019
News_headline: New Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has begun her innings on a non-transparent note that affects her budget estimates for revenues, expenditure and fiscal deficit.

News_title: Union Budget 2019 is not populist but can increase the pace of development in the country
News_headline: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman opted for economic development as opposed to people-pleasing for the 2019-2020 budget and it makes sense.

News_title: Modi 2.0 Budget is high on hope, less on specifics
News_headline: A classic case of having fingers in too many pies, despite the boost for electric vehicles and startups, the Budget failed to enthuse the stock markets

News_title: Ready But Unarmed: Why India's defence budget 2019 is such a huge letdown
News_headline: The defence budget has seen no increase from the overall interim budget, which falls well short of weaponry and investments our armed forces desperately need, given our challenges.

News_title: The Jumlas of Pakistan: Pak says Hafiz Saeed will be arrested. Yet again.
News_headline: Pakistan faces world disapproval and the drying of funds over its support to terrorists like Hafiz Saeed. But its moves to 'take action' are impressing no-one.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: For the first time, the Union Budget encourages India's startup entrepreneurs in heartening detail
News_headline: From cutting angel tax to portraying startup entrepreneurs on TV, Union Budget 2019 gives a much-needed boost to young risk-takers in India, also making them a motor of growth.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: Nirmala Sitharaman sets the pitch for transformative inclusive growth
News_headline: Huge outlays for infrastructure development and power generation as well as public-private partnership in railways will help India's overall growth.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: Nirmala Sitharaman's maiden Budget is long on intent, short on detail
News_headline: A Union Budget must be more than a roll-call of schemes, however innovative.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: Nirmala Sitharaman presented an inclusive, ambitious, growth-oriented budget
News_headline: Naysayers accusing the Budget of taking baby steps without radical reforms have clearly missed the plot.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: It made the right noises but rushed past concrete measures for full infra development
News_headline: Nirmala Sitharaman's maiden Budget underscored the vital role of infrastructure in India's growth. However, it also missed on a number of key areas to strengthen exactly that.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: Middle class India will find its expenses rising after Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget
News_headline: Here's how taxpayers will feel the pinch of Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2019.

News_title: How Indira Gandhi's Congress Declined: Ironically, it's not the INC but Narendra Modi who's following her footsteps
News_headline: Indira Gandhi built the Congress on toughness, empathy and pride in roots, culture and national security. Today's Congress leaders seem determined to dissipate her legacy.

News_title: Budget speech live streaming: Watch live streaming of budget on Aaj Tak
News_headline: Sitharaman is likely to aim to revive growth through higher investments.

News_title: Budget Live Streaming: How to watch live telecast Union Budget 2019 Lok Sabha Tv
News_headline: India's economy has hit a five-year low growth of 6.8 per cent in 2018-19. All eyes are now on how the finance minister proposes to steer the economy.

News_title: Budget 2019 and the Goddess Equation: How 'Badlav' will come, but women must remain as ‘Lakshmi’
News_headline: If you know that your daughter will bring you wealth and victory, you may treat your daughter well. That, at least, is what our economic planners seem to be hoping.

News_title: From Raja to Commoner Rank: Once AP CM, Chandrababu Naidu is today facing a huge reversal of fortune
News_headline: Used to regal treatment, Naidu now undergoes frisking, downgrading of privileges, even the breaking of structures he built. His party alleges it's vendetta. Yet, it's all within the rules.

News_title: Economic Survey 2019: How the medium of PM Modi's messaging found a special mention in the CEA's report
News_headline: Unlike earlier Economic Surveys which stuck to statistics, CEA Krishnamurthy Subramanian highlighted positive messaging campaigns which changed social values, helping key govt schemes.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: Do we really need a Gandhipedia?
News_headline: The FM mentioned Gandhiji, his life and the proposed new govt encyclopedia about him. But there's only one thing about Gandhi ji we actually don't know.

News_title: Budget 2019 must be big and bold: Nirmala Sitharaman must go for serious capital infusion and tangible tax breaks
News_headline: For a govt that has taken bold steps like demonetisation, new strong measures should be a logical follow-on. India's struggling economy certainly needs these.

News_title: Nirmala, Nusrat, Chandrani, Pramila: Why we are applauding all the women MPs in the House
News_headline: This Lok Sabha has the highest number of women MPs. They cut across the political spectrum and voice a variety of concerns. They have only one thing in common. They make us proud.

News_title: Union Budget 2019: Will FM Nirmala Sitharaman continue the tradition of carrying a briefcase, or will she give this a spin?
News_headline: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will likely carry the Union Budget 2019 in a briefcase as she steps into Parliament. The case is part of colonial tradition. Will Sitharaman finally decolonise it?

News_title: Rahul Gandhi quits: But the Congress' drama still carries on. Will it get real or more surreal?
News_headline: By resigning, Rahul has ended a painful version of 'Dynasty' for his party. But can the Congress now cut out the dialogues and get to real work?

News_title: When netas beat us up: Why BJP's Akash Vijayvargiya and other politicians like 'justice', Sanjay Gandhi-style
News_headline: Akash Vijaywargiya is the latest entrant to this hall of fame. From Biju Patnaik to Imran Hussain, many politicians have shown a tenderness for beating up people.

News_title: Zaira Wasim's decision to quit is sinister: This is not spiritualism but dangerous political Islam
News_headline: In this view, women of the faith can have no freedom, no talent, no life beyond being actual and sexual slaves of men. Who are free to do as they like. Zaira Wasim's withdrawal is so scary.

News_title: PM Modi on 'Batman' Akash Vijayvargiya: PM Modi's words are strong. But actions speak louder than words
News_headline: And those actions are missing here. It is appalling that Vijayvargiya remains a member of the party, a week after beating up a govt official with a bat, cameras capturing every detail.

News_title: Amit Shah has the will to thaw Jammu and Kashmir ice
News_headline: Ultimately, the issue is not only legal but political. The government and the BJP must demonstrate the political will to eliminate Article 370. As the adage goes: “Where there is a will, there is a way.

News_title: Wiping the Board Clean: Central Educational Institutions Bill 2019 shows Modi govt's commitment to social inclusion in academia
News_headline: The passing of the bill is a major decision which promises to put an end to decades of Left-wing perpetuated anarchy in the university system.

News_title: Before mob violence becomes populist rhetoric: Individualize Tabrez’s story, do not just reduce him to a statistic
News_headline: Tabrez is much more than a statistic of mob lynching. We need to individualize his story, go into each detail of the incident and hold the perpetrators responsible.

News_title: Amit Shah, Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Kashmir: How the Home Minister interprets the former Prime Minister's 'Kashmir Doctrine'
News_headline: Both views of J&K quote 'Insaniyat, Jamhooriyat, Kashmiriyat'. But there are also very significant differences between the two views.

News_title: Saving Citizen Zaira: The young actor has made a dangerous choice, which shows how alienated Kashmiri Muslims today feel
News_headline: Talented Kashmiri youth like Zaira Wasim are feeling alienated in a hostile, polarised atmosphere. Certain forces are exploiting the situation. This is the time for liberal India to speak up.

News_title: Rahul Gandhi quits: But the Congress still has a future with hope in it. It's up to the party to unearth that
News_headline: With Rahul Gandhi quitting, and Sonia and Priyanka Gandhi apparently choosing to take a back seat for now, the Congress stands at a crossroads in political time.

News_title: Big challenges, bigger intent: Why Budget 2019 will be the Modi govt's most exciting test so far
News_headline: Modi 2.0 can't blame the prior govt for any economic weaknesses. Neither can it afford to slow investments or reforms, for these could be the key to its continued political strength.

News_title: The Modi Masterstroke: How GST unified India
News_headline: The Congress sat on the GST for years and did nothing. In contrast, the Modi govt both implemented this path-breaking reform and kept improving it, to benefit the common citizen in multiple ways.

News_title: A Balakot that wasn’t: Vajpayee planned strike post Parliament attack in 2001
News_headline: A Prime Minister to Remember written by former Navy Chief Admiral Sushil Kumar reveals the aftermath of the brazen terrorist attack on the Indian Parliament and the ill-timed Operation Parakram.

News_title: What's really biting Kashmir: Separatists have softened their stand with Modi 2.0. But the problem is deeper
News_headline: Home Minister Amit Shah has made the Modi 2.0 govt's tough stand on Kashmir amply clear. This extends to dealings with Pakistan as well. But the Valley faces a whole new threat.

News_title: Cross-Border Drugs: A huge 532-kg heroin haul caught at Attari post exposes the gap in our war on drugs
News_headline: If the biggest ever heroin catch was planned for smuggling into India through the Pakistan-routed trade corridor, just imagine what we are receiving where there are no check-posts.

News_title: The latest 'star is born': Our liberals must go ga-ga over Mahua Moitra. Their other stars have vanished!
News_headline: After Hardik Patel, Shehla Rashid, Kanhaiya Kumar and Atishi Marlena, Mahua Moitra is the latest gem in a long list of liberal heroes. None of them has much in common. Except one thing.

News_title: Ban Fatwas - These have no place in a secular, modern state
News_headline: The latest fatwa against MP Nusrat Jahan shows why it is imperative to come down heavily on these despicable judgements.

News_title: MP’s Very Own Batmen: Why entitled sons of politicians think they can get away with anything
News_headline: Kailash Vijayvargiya’s son Akash Bijayvargiya assaulted a municipal officer with a bat and got a lot of backlash for the same, deservedly so. Hence proved, entitled and privileged politicians can stoop to any low.

News_title: Why CM Pinarayi is on the backfoot
News_headline: LDF has to realise that there is no political space for violence in Kerala. The new generation in Kerala doesn’t like violence, brutality or oppression. Their sympathy goes with the victims.

News_title: No kid gloves for Kashmir: The Modi govt has a new iron-fisted policy for the Valley. Will it work?
News_headline: No talks with separatists. No soft touch for established political parties. No rush for Assembly elections. Kashmir is seeing a tough new approach from the Centre. What results will this yield?

News_title: Is Mamata losing the plot? From doctors' strike to ‘cut money’ debacle, Didi is plunging into crisis
News_headline: The TMC supremo seems absolutely unable to handle either provocations from the BJP or pressures within her own party. Will Mamata Banerjee push the TMC to breaking point?

News_title: Mainly Bold, Incidentally Beautiful: Why Nusrat Jahan should inspire the young women of India
News_headline: She has held her own, calmly and quietly, through both the trolling and celebration of her attire in Parliament. There is a lot more to TMC MP Nusrat Jahan than meets the eye.

News_title: 'Junaid was lynched. But we'll live and die as Indians'
News_headline: On June 22 two years ago, Junaid was lynched in a train, targeted in a fight over his skull cap. His family still lives in shock, fear and grief. But they are determined to get justice for Junaid.

News_title: Uncle Sam, please don’t preach: India doesn't need Mike Pompeo's advice on secularism. USA should introspect
News_headline: Irony ran wild as Mike Pompeo tried lecturing India on rights even as children, migrants and hapless minorities suffer abuse, attacks and discrimination in the land of the brave and free.

News_title: Xi Jinping and Trump are having a bad year. Modi isn’t and he should capitalize on it during the G20 Summit
News_headline: With heightened tensions between US and Iran, and India slapping tariffs on US exports, Modi will have to adopt a clear-eyed strategy at the summit.

News_title: Muslims deserve their rights: Pushing a Uniform Civil Code will not unite India. It will only create more tension
News_headline: If the government is seriously concerned about women impacted by polygamy, it should look at the high statistics of Hindu men doing the same. Instead, it is selectively targeting Muslims.

News_title: Talk About What? India should not waste a second with the Hurriyat, Pakistan's poisonous spent force
News_headline: If Delhi talks to anyone, it must be to Kashmir's elected representatives and other stakeholders, not waste time on the perfidious and pointless Hurriyat, which has only harmed India's interests.

News_title: Not saffron but secular: The banning of instant triple talaq is a crucial first step towards Uniform Civil Code
News_headline: Just like regressive divorce practices, ruled by religious notions, can't be allowed, neither should we accept the lack of a secular Uniform Civil Code, which 'minority appeasers' denied India thus far.

News_title: Why KCR loves his Vaastu: Will a new and expensive vaastu-compliant secretariat strengthen KCR's regime?
News_headline: Telangana CM K Chandrasekhar Rao laid the foundation stone for a new Assembly-secretariat complex in accordance with Vaastu. Good luck to KCR even as his state faces huge difficulties.

News_title: Because of their aukaat: Why the BJP will not take Kailash Vijayvargiya and his son Akash to task
News_headline: 'Like father, like son' is such an understatement for Kailash Vijayvargiya and Akash.

News_title: Junaid, Akhlaq, Tabrez: Muslims aside, we are also lynching our laws and legal system each and every time
News_headline: Most of the accused in cases of lynching have either been released on bail or never arrested at all. This is despite the Supreme Court's severe injunction to the authorities to ensure justice.

News_title: Pompeo, Jaishankar set interesting stage for Modi and Trump talks
News_headline: Despite all the baggage, Pompeo’s visit has succeeded in injecting a renewed vigour in Indo-US bilateral discourse and in Jaishankar he managed to find a partner who is equally focused on delivering practical outcomes.

News_title: Is Congress in a coma? The only person who really seems to care is PM Modi
News_headline: The grand old party seems adamant to cling to the Nehru-Gandhis and not reinvent. But PM Modi's continuing obsession with the Congress also indicates that perhaps all isn't lost for it.

News_title: When India needs to intervene: As our international role expands, so must our capabilities
News_headline: As US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's visit shows, India will be expected to play a far greater interventionist role in the region now. But, with China in the backdrop, just how prepared are we?

News_title: Living without Sanjiv Bhatt: It's been over nine months. I haven't had any tea as I can't have it with Sanjiv on our balcony
News_headline: Former IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt has been sentenced to life imprisonment by Jamnagar Sessions Court in Gujarat, which found him guilty in a 1990 custodial death case. Bhatt's wife Shweta writes on life without him.

News_title: An anonymous student: I am a Muslim. But I can't tell anyone my name. What if they decide to lynch me?
News_headline: A protest was organised against the recent lynching of 24-year-old Tabrez Ansari in Jharkhand. Diverse people gathered, from Delhi University professors to a shy little seven-year-old girl. I attended too.

News_title: Uddhav Thackeray, Devendra Fadnavis: A match made in political heaven
News_headline: But even as the two leaders get closer, many wonder about the rising speculation about Aditya Thackeray for Maharashtra's next CM.

News_title: Tweet More, Rahul: After the outrage Rahul Gandhi’s ‘new India’ tweet sparked, he should call out Modi govt much more
News_headline: Yoga Day became all about Narendra Modi once again. It took a tweet by Rahul Gandhi to call this out. But Rahul needs to raise his voice on far more serious issues, and far more often.

News_title: How Nusrat and Mimi finally fit into Parliament: Sindoor. Bindi. Chooda. Sari. And salwar-suit
News_headline: Who knew fashion had such superpowers!

News_title: The dying political parties of India: These six parties face total extinction. Or can they ride out the saffron tide?
News_headline: There's still one way to continue to be relevant. But can these parties make the transition?

News_title: The trains ran on time, the press crawled: An Emergency lesson was that Indians are not obsessed with political freedom
News_headline: We romanticised the 1977 election ending Mrs Gandhi's rule. Sterilisation and the Opposition's imprisonment showed the Gandhis to be amateurs. Anyone could learn from their mistakes today.

News_title: My Rebuttal to Sania Ahmad's 'Open Letter to Muslims': Stop blaming the victim. Muslim backwardness is not Muslims' fault!
News_headline: This is in response to Sania Ahmad’s piece, “Open letter to my fellow Muslims: Please step out of the ‘we are oppressed’ narrative. Fix what you can!” It's time we stop bashing Muslims for their state.

News_title: How to Save the Congress: Only a 'Gandhi Mukt Congress' can avert 'Congress Mukt Bharat'
News_headline: Rahul Gandhi's petulance and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's weakness is no longer the glue that will hold Congress together. The party urgently needs an interim President and real party elections.

News_title: SP-BSP break-up: Why Mayawati's fresh hostility against former 'bhatija' Akhilesh Yadav is no surprise
News_headline: The 'gathbandhan' between 'bua' Maya and 'bhatija' Akhilesh was based on the shaky ground of mutual distrust and political desperation. It had to collapse, with Mayawati blaming Akhilesh.

News_title: A Partition Mentality: Those supporting Triple Talaq are displaying the same mindset which once brutally divided India
News_headline: Triple talaq has always been considered sinful in Islamic law. Countries like Iraq banned it as far back as 1909. There is a reason this evil has persisted in India till the present day. That must end.

News_title: Emergency in Kerala: The trains ran on time, young students like P Rajan were killed
News_headline: The Emergency meant a surface of tranquility in Union-ridden Kerala. But under the surface, tremendous brutality simmered, which burst forth in the P Rajan case that rocked the state.

News_title: Why I think Pakistan was, is and will always remain a terrorist state
News_headline: Just establishing terror camps and sending jihadis to India isn't terrorism. Terrorising a section of your own people is also terrorism. And Pakistan, by its very nature, cannot stop doing that.

News_title: Checkmate for Chandrababu Naidu? As TDP MPs join BJP, Naidu may meet his nemesis in his own proteges
News_headline: Is BJP going to wipe out TDP from Andhra? Or is the TDP MPs' move to the saffron party actually a clever ploy by Naidu?

News_title: The Pluses of Dynasty: Finally, anti-dynast Mayawati also gets this
News_headline: We don’t know what’ll happen to the party now. But at least Mayawati is not repeating Kanshi Ram’s mistake.

News_title: Pakistani Army at Lord's: When the Pak army went to watch cricket in London, on someone else's money
News_headline: What's now clear is that all the money actually belongs to the Pakistan army. Questioning that only invites trouble. No wonder there were slogans of 'Pak Fauj Zindabad' at Lord's.

News_title: The dead bitterness of litchis: Encephalitis, 'expiries' and my memories of a hospital ward
News_headline: Five years later, the story remains the same in Muzaffarpur: the song of beeping monitors, the unblinking eyes of children and their frothing mouths.

News_title: Lynching versus Love: There is so much more to 'Jai Shri Ram' than forcing a non-Hindu to say it
News_headline: A Muslim man, beaten to death recently, was also forced to chant ‘Jai Shri Ram’. The words are a weapon today but there was once an India where non-Hindus said 'Jai Shri Ram' with joy.

News_title: Sab Maya Hai: But Mayawati's nephew is a natural successor to the BSP supremo. Why so surprised?
News_headline: Why are people surprised by Mayawati’s decision to bequeath the BSP to Akash Anand? Is it the first time we're seeing a rich party go from a senior to junior relative's hands?

News_title: Unexplained, unrestrained expenses and bloated budget: Analysing Pakistan’s defence spending
News_headline: The problem is that continuing to spend on defence will not stall Pakistan's slide towards the financial abyss that is staring it in the face, which means - Pakistan is damned if it cuts its defence budget, and damned if it doesn’t.

News_title: From Chits to Doctors' Prescriptions: Saving Bengal from Mamata Banerjee, a note at a time
News_headline: The recent doctors' strike signals danger for Mamata Banerjee. In her tenure, Bengal saw fervent minority appeasement, harsh political violence and deep corruption. Can it be cured?

News_title: Seven Reasons Why Asaduddin Owaisi is wrong on Triple Talaq
News_headline: Mr Owaisi's arguments do not hold real ground. As I see it, if he was really concerned about the plight of Muslim women, he would support the govt's Bill against Triple Talaq.

News_title: When Indira Gandhi declared Emergency: 44 years ago, the build-up to the suspension of our liberties
News_headline: In June 1975, the political climate around Indira Gandhi was growing stormier by the second. On the 25 of June, Emergency was declared. But the build-up was full of strange stories and characters.

News_title: A Very Deep Cut: Why Mamata Banerjee asking TMC party men to stop taking 'cut money' is just too little, too late
News_headline: As reports emerge of Didi apparently telling party workers to return money taken from hapless people, will anyone listen? This only opens a Pandora's Box, one the Opposition will exploit.

News_title: That fuzzy 'anti-national': Yogi Adityanath’s diktat to private universities in UP is confounding many, and scaring some
News_headline: UP CM’s recent ordinance, banning ‘anti-national’ activities on campuses, has left many wondering just why such an order was needed when there are already sufficient laws on this?

News_title: Cricket World Cup 2019 shows the best and worst of our time
News_headline: Is rainy England the right place for the game to be played? From teams getting one point each and upsetting the points table to un-resumed games and Duckworth-Lewis – a partially played World Cup is not a World Cup.

News_title: Dear Indian intellectuals, we are not fools: Faux regional language lovers closed the poor's access to English for years
News_headline: But politicians like Jagan Reddy have sensed the yearning among the masses for English medium instruction and will provide this, despite the intellectuals hissing this is a 'World Bank agenda'.

News_title: Bengal of Bombs and Fire: It is heartbreaking to see the soul of my Sonar Bangla bleed amidst the violence
News_headline: The state of Bengal is on edge with different political factions violently targeting each other and civilians becoming cannon fodder. Even Imran Khan's Tagore gaffe didn't make Bengalis laugh.

News_title: Open Letter to my fellow Muslims: Please step out of the ‘we are oppressed’ narrative. Fix what you can!
News_headline: As a Muslim, I know we face blatant, rampant discrimination. But complaining about it, and writing posts, won't help. Improving our own lot, one step at a time, will.

News_title: World Cup 2019: Why I've stopped watching India play cricket
News_headline: Once known as the gentleman’s game, the sport has turned bats into weapons for hyper-nationalism and for advertising opportunities. This is now war, of a different kind.

News_title: US vs Iran: As US flights start to avoid Iran, is the airspace mayhem just the beginning?
News_headline: Where does India feature in this tension, which can soon snowball into a huge crisis?

News_title: Muslim 'protests' too little, too late: What were ‘prominent’ Bengali Muslims doing before Lok Sabha polls 2019?
News_headline: The letter written by ‘prominent’ Bengali Muslims to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee only highlights their silence in several earlier cases.

News_title: Hear The Hindu Voice: Simply chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' doesn't make a person a Hindu fanatic. But MPs chanting this are evading their jobs
News_headline: In the Lok Sabha, we have now heard the chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' and ‘Allah Hu Akbar,’ but why do politicians shout religious slogans rather than voice the people's right to food, clothing and shelter?

News_title: A Volatile Persian Gulf: US-Iran tensions have spiked. Their conflict is being closely watched by Russia and China
News_headline: Following attacks on a US tanker and a drone, President Trump nearly ordered a surgical strike on Iran. As the region stands at the brink of escalation, some are watching with great interest.

News_title: Pledge no 'anti-national' activity: Why Yogi Adityanath's campus ordinance should scare us all
News_headline: Kanhaiya Kumar, Umar Khalid and Anirban Bhattacharya were booked for sedition. Charges could never be proved and yet they suffered. This ordinance could only worsen that scenario.

News_title: Dear Arvind Subramanian, India’s economic growth rate has not been overestimated. Here is why I am countering you
News_headline: Revisions in GDP numbers happened regularly, even during Congress-led dispensations. Singling out the Modi govt for a routine revision in line with global best practices is sheer hypocrisy.

News_title: Sanjiv Bhatt sentenced. Why this case should not become about Bhatt vs Narendra Modi

News_headline: The govt will set up a panel to explore the efficacy of 'One Nation, One Election'. But there are already ways possible of reducing poll expenditure and ensuring uninterrupted development work.

News_title: Indian-Pakistani bhai-bhai? No. There are deep cracks in the South Asian diaspora abroad too
News_headline: Ties between Indian and Pakistani diaspora abroad stood the test of time. But following Pakistan's support to terrorism, hurting both India and the West, this relationship is showing deep cracks.

News_title: Defence Budget 2019: India's defence spend is among the world's lowest. Meanwhile, China, Pakistan modernise their forces

News_title: Will Congress Implode: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has been imposed on Congressmen. If they don’t speak up now, they never will

News_title: Joshua Wong: 'Hong Kong is not afraid of Beijing's Communist state. They will pay for the crackdown on us'

News_title: The Sound of Dog-Whistling: 'Vande Mataram' itself is not communal. But using it to target Asaduddin Owaisi is

News_title: Mukherjee Nagar Clash: I refuse to identify with Sarabjeet. But can a modern police force identify with the cops who attacked him?
News_headline: The fracas in Mukherjee Nagar shows several lines, of religious identity, secular permission and civil rights, being breached. No one emerges from this looking good.

News_title: Can the media stop baiting the RSS?
News_headline: The RSS was a threat to Indira Gandhi’s authoritarianism, but to accuse it of being fascist or anti-national is wrong and Indian media needs to realise this.

News_title: Happy Birthday, Rahul Gandhi! Let's reflect on the year that was

News_title: Hello, Bye, ISI: Pakistan removes ISI chief in just eight months. Why this change doesn't matter

News_title: India’s Infantry Combat Vehicles project may just die from apathy

News_title: Power cuts for power play in Madhya Pradesh

News_headline: With a brute majority of 303 seats, what exactly is Modi's Muslim outreach trying to achieve?

News_title: Why Imran Khan doesn’t care

News_title: Can Modi government fix the false secular narrative?

News_title: PM Modi's Oath: Pakistan should not play down Imran Khan not being invited to Modi's swearing-in

News_headline: Among the BJP leaders likely to get key ministries are Amit Shah, Rajnath Singh, Smriti Irani, Nitin Gadkari and Piyush Goyal. Watch PM Modi's oath taking ceremony here:

News_headline: The last thing Pakistan wanted was Narendra Modi back as India's PM. They'd have preferred the Congress which is seen as soft on them. But how did Indira Gandhi's party reach such a state?
