News_headline: No, voting is not about fashion. Yet, from white to kesari, one cannot miss the obvious coincidences!

News_title: The Killing Fields of West Bengal: Once famed for paddy and mustard, rural Bengal is now overrun by murder
News_headline: Bengal has always been known for terrible political violence. However, recently this has taken a horrific new form. The growing challenge to the TMC posed by the BJP is clearly unnerving many.

News_title: The loss of discourse
News_headline: The 2019 election destroyed democratic discourse. Modi set the tone, Opposition parties respond in kind.

News_title: Ayodhya, Bofors, Communalism: Why India needs to remember Rajiv Gandhi’s reign as PM
News_headline: Narendra Modi now represents a school of political thought that is entirely opposed to what Rajiv Gandhi stood for and the Congress continues to represent.

News_title: Voting with the Gandhis: Rahul, Priyanka, Sonia. Three different booths, three different pictures
News_headline: The way the Gandhis voted mirrors the changing landscape of their own family.

News_title: Swara Bhasker: 'BJP's Hindutva polarises, talks of war between Hindus-Muslims. It's getting harder for other parties to escape Hindutva'
News_headline: Bollywood actor Swara Bhasker is famous for her unrelenting criticism of the powers that be. Speaking with Rohit E David, Swara talked about Hindutva, AAP, Congress, being trolled by misogynists and Bollywood.

News_title: Naya Pakistan, Purana Debt Trap: Why an IMF bailout package of $6 billion places Imran Khan in a painful spot
News_headline: After trying to avoid the IMF, Pakistan is back at its knees. However, the current bail-out package proposed is a tough one for Islamabad to swallow. Can Imran Khan survive this strain?

News_title: Low Voter Turnout in Delhi Polls: Heat, pro-incumbency, disgust with cheap political tactics are blamed
News_headline: Braving the blazing summer heat at 40 degrees Celsius, Delhiites stepped out to exercise their franchise for their seven seats. However, the turnout was notably less than other years.

News_title: When Mamata Banerjee Met Her Meme: Woman arrested for posting Didi's meme. Where's the free speech lobby now?
News_headline: Why is Mamata Banerjee against Photoshop? Was her in PeeCee’s Met Gala look funny enough, or should we go for the ‘aunty gormint’ meme? Will we all end up behind bars now?

News_title: Sexist Like Sidhu: Hey Navjot Sidhu, you're not on a slapstick show anymore. Can you please fire your speechwriter?
News_headline: Don’t you listen to what you say? Does everything look like a comedy show to you? Or have you run out of political weapons to hit opponents with, falling back on unbridled sexism?

News_title: What’s wrong with NYAY?
News_headline: Rahul Gandhi’s ambitious Nyuntam Aay Yojana or NYAY would have been a great plan in utopian India. In the real world, it is just anyaay.

News_title: How To Vote: All you need to know to cast your vote for Lok Sabha 2019, Phase 6
News_headline: From finding your polling booth to vote timings, here’s a ready reckoner for elections 2019

News_title: The 'hua-toh-hua' controversy: Can PM Modi pledge a genocide law to counter Sam Pitroda's remark on 1984?
News_headline: Mentions of the anti-Sikh riots of 1984 are routinely made around polls. Nothing real is done to alleviate the pain of those who suffered or those who remain vulnerable to such genocide.

News_title: When Rafale didn't fly: Over-attention to one issue has proven to be a bad political investment for Congress
News_headline: This article has been co-authored by Ramanand, who works with the Center of Policy Research and Governance and Sumit Gupta, student of National University of Juridical Sciences, Kolkata.

News_title: Lowest Uncommon Denominator: Why I think Narendra Modi knowingly lowered the level of political discourse
News_headline: It has been helpful to Modi and the BJP to cover up failures and flaws with insults and allegations. However, when the Opposition responds in kind, the PM doesn't seem to like it.

News_title: Mother's Day, Mother's Way: So, which political mom reminds you of your mother?
News_headline: On Mother's Day, we take a look at some of the popular mothers in the world of politics and the mommy image that fits them best!

News_title: An Old Delhi Diary: Residents of the Walled City have a modern voting strategy, one that prioritises development for them
News_headline: Old Delhi decides its new representative on Sunday. A walk through the walled lanes revealed energetic and impassioned political opinions.

News_title: 'Dishonouring the Dead': Who can beat the Congress in this dept?
News_headline: From Sardar Patel to PV Narasimha Rao, the list of illustrious leaders reportedly scorned by the Congress, even in their final journeys, is a long one.

News_title: Next in their sights: Why India should be extremely wary of American Islamism
News_headline: Anti-Indian and pro-Kashmiri separatist activism in the US has previously been linked to Pakistani intelligence agencies. But analysts may now be overlooking the role of American Islamist movements.

News_title: Time for a break: From blue lagoons to national parks, Rajiv Gandhi's vacations shocked 1980s India
News_headline: It was the first time India had a happily married PM. And one who believed in flamboyant holidays with family and friends.

News_title: Whose surgical strike anyway: The armed forces are caught in a messy tug-of-war between the BJP and the Congress
News_headline: The politicisation of the armed forces and attacks on Pakistan continues unabated in the final leg of Lok Sabha Elections 2019.

News_title: Do Women Count? For all their purported devotion to women, which political party actually empowered Indian women?
News_headline: More Indian women have voted than Indian men. But the number of Indian women empowered to stand as political candidates is miserable. Do our women-friendly political parties even care?

News_title: Computers, Cronies and Corruption Charges: Deconstructing Rajiv Gandhi’s legacy
News_headline: Known for Bofors and the anti-Sikh pogrom, less known for peace accords and modernising the armed forces. Famed for coteries, including an Italian one, the Rajiv years echo in our politics even today.

News_title: Manish Sisodia: Congress is tired, no one trusts it. Its thinking, like Sheila Dikshit on Nirbhaya, made Delhi turn away
News_headline: Delhi’s deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia went on a padh yatra in Khichripur. Supporters say his roadshows are fun because he actually bothers to interact with people on the route.

News_title: Shadows of NRC: 35 years after 1983's Nellie massacre, why the issue of ‘foreigners’ in Assam is boiling
News_headline: BJP president Amit Shah says NRC should be implemented nationwide. It has meanwhile hit problems even in Assam, which has faced the 'locals versus foreigners' debate for decades now.

News_title: Delhi's Political Bazaar: How the non-NDA parties have started working out their post-May 23 equations
News_headline: If the BJP doesn't get a majority, several players will be in high demand in Delhi's political bazaar. These include Mayawati, KCR and Mamata Banerjee. These also include the Congress vying for key ministries.

News_title: When Didi Speaks of Slaps: Mamata Banerjee wanting to give PM Modi a 'tight slap of democracy' actually insults democracy
News_headline: Banerjee should be condemned unequivocally for unleashing both a language and a culture of violence in Bengal. Ironically, many have teamed up with her in the name of 'saving democracy'.

News_title: Dear Arvind Kejriwal, an open letter from a South Indian in India's capital
News_headline: Cut back on your racism against us, sir. South Indians are not illegal foreigners in our own capital.

News_title: BJP's Smriti Irani 2.0: How Nirahua could upset SP-BSP’s poll calculations in Azamgarh
News_headline: Dinesh Lal Yadav aka Nirahua is one the highest paid Bhojpuri actors. The fact that he is a Yadav brightens his poll prospects. His self-made image will also help dent dynasty's hold.

News_title: Woman versus PM: Shalini Yadav is challenger to PM Modi in Varanasi, fighting him where Congress faltered
News_headline: In the crucial Benaras election, locals are mystified about the Congress' choice of Ajay Rai. Meanwhile, the rooted Shalini Yadav takes on PM Modi as the gathbandhan's candidate.

News_title: Battle for Bhopal: Why the RSS chose the capital of 'Madhya Prant' to field Sadhvi Pragya
News_headline: Madhya Pradesh has always been a laboratory for the RSS. This time though, it is trying its biggest experiment yet.

News_title: Australia votes on environment. India is yet to wake up.
News_headline: While Australia is set to decide its Prime Minister based on environmental policies, pollution seems to be a non-issue for the Indian electorate that breathes the most toxic air in the world.

News_title: From Bofors to 'Brashtachari', Indian politics changed under Narendra Modi. Rahul Gandhi is perhaps the last to know
News_headline: By taking on Modi with 'Chowkidar Chor Hai', Rahul Gandhi perhaps thought he was avenging Bofors. He didn't realise the new tenacity and bite in political leaders today, until the rejoinder arrived.

News_title: Prakash Raj: Just like BJP, Congress also doesn't want secular voices. There is only one vision for India now
News_headline: Actor Prakash Raj has been camping in Delhi to support to the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). He discussed his frustration with BJP, his disappointment with Congress and his hopes of a new political vision.

News_title: Will the real Sadhvi please stand up: 7,000 ‘sadhus’ doing a havan for Digvijaya Singh makes Bhopal one big saffron blur
News_headline: Digvijaya Singh was supposed to be the rational, heck, normal candidate standing against Sadhvi Pragya in Bhopal. That's until he invited 7,000 sadhus to do a havan, including a mirchi havan, and 'hot yoga' for him.

News_title: Why Army will have to wait more for new carbines
News_headline: A technical committee of the ministry of defence has raised questions over pricing.

News_title: PA Fazal Gafoor: Why I banned face veils for Muslim women on my campuses
News_headline: PA Fazal Gafoor, head of the Muslim Education Society in Kerala, which has imposed a ban on face veils for women students, discusses why this decision was made.

News_title: Pulwama Blast, Tiny Turn-Out: Its name has been on every neta's lips. Yet, Pulwama saw no festival of democracy today
News_headline: Pulwama, Ground Zero of the February 14 suicide attack in which over 40 soldiers died, goes to the polls today. But this is marked by an eerie silence, not the good cheer of voting crowds.

News_title: 'Brashtachari Number One': Why has our political discourse hit a shocking new low?
News_headline: Leaders may come and leaders may go, but our morals and ideals should stay intact, no matter how dire the circumstances may be.

News_title: Rahul Gandhi vs Smriti Irani: 5 reasons why Amethi matters so deeply
News_headline: Amethi is a fierce clash, one that embodies this election best. But, whatever its results, Amethi already has a winner.

News_title: The Battle for Bhopal, and India: It's Sadhvi Pragya vs Digvijay Singh and regression vs progress
News_headline: Sadhvi Pragya and Digvijay Singh are all set for battle. This is probably the first time ever that a terror accused has been given a Parliamentary ticket by a mainstream party. That itself speaks volumes.

News_title: Naya Pakistan: Will it be a country of accountability?
News_headline: Nothing changes in Pakistan. Today what is happening is a mere repetition of what has happened again and again.

News_title: By Karma and God's Grace: Why Hindutva economics never discusses poverty or the poor
News_headline: In Hindutva's view, the gods created the rich and poor based on karma and caste. Hence, there is no need to interfere much with poverty. Growth will occur as long as the rich get richer.

News_title: A Decision Most Strange: BJP leader’s brutal killing in J&K exposes deadly negligence in understanding security threats
News_headline: It is said even the Raj Bhavan is displeased at the way security cover to key persons in the Valley was revoked. However, the choice of probe has raised even more questions in Kashmir.

News_title: The Good, Bad and Portentous: Narendra Modi's five-year report card, and how this compares to Mrs Indira Gandhi
News_headline: Since Modi’s leadership has been closely compared to Indira Gandhi’s, what lessons can he learn from her rise, fall and rise?

News_title: 'Coming Soon': The 'jihadi' threat to West Bengal is very real. We need to take it very seriously
News_headline: The bloodiest terror attack in Bangladesh on July 1, 2016, was an eye-opener when the five dead terrorists were profiled. Today, their ghosts have resurfaced, and issued a warning to West Bengal.

News_title: Lok Sabha Elections 2019: Musings from my election tourism in Uttar Pradesh
News_headline: Stepping away from the hyperbole, the marketing and the media blitzkrieg, I went on a personal campaign trail through Uttar Pradesh. Here's what I found.

News_title: Don't sing like Amar Singh: Neta compares MJ Akbar case with allegations against CJI, distills all of Me Too to 'vengeful women'
News_headline: The naya chowkidar slams Azam Khan’s misogyny but defends MJ Akbar and claims women won't get employment if they 'besmirch the image of a high placed male'.

News_title: How an empowered rural economy forms the bedrock of the Modi govt's long-term strategies for 2022
News_headline: Modi govt has invested tremendous transformative projects in rural India, from water conservation to soil testing, etc. The results include bumper production to once water-dry areas like Latur, now not needing even a water tanker!

News_title: Misa Bharti, RJD: 'Lalu Prasad is an ideology. They called his govt 'jungle raj'. But what happened in Muzaffarpur Girls Home under Nitish Kumar?'
News_headline: Misa Bharti, daughter of jailed RJD chief Lalu Prasad, is fighting elections from Patliputra, Bihar. Speaking with Rohit E David, Misa discussed her father, reports of a family feud and governance by Nitish Kumar.

News_title: In Vajpayee's Footsteps: Why Rajnath Singh is striking a chord in Lucknow, just like a former BJP leader
News_headline: Singh is reaching out to every section of society, including Muslims, despite knowing he stands a very easy chance at winning.

News_title: What tough election? A Modi wave will sweep Uttar Pradesh. Here's why I say so
News_headline: While some would have us believe that the BJP is going to suffer big losses in the state, ground reality shows us exactly the opposite.

News_title: Sorry, Mrs Dikshit! But the Nirbhaya outrage was not 'media manufactured'
News_headline: If Sheila Dikshit thinks she had no responsibility for the 2012 gangrape, then she must think twice before seeking votes.

News_title: Red Terror vs Our Error: The dastardly Maoist attack in Gadchiroli should serve as a strong wake-up call. We must tackle Naxal violence now
News_headline: Maoist attacks equal almost 60% of terrorist violence in India over the last two decades. Yet, we seem unprepared in the face of growing danger. However, there can be clear ways to security as well.

News_title: Kanhaiya Kumar: 'I don't regret being called 'Tukde tukde gang'. BJP's breaking the country. Anyone who opposes them is called 'Tukde tukde gang'
News_headline: Kanhaiya Kumar, JNU student leader and CPI candidate, spoke with Rohit E David about fighting polls in Begusarai, whether his followers are 'champagne socialists' and why he doesn't regret being called 'tukde tukde gang'.

News_title: Separatist Leader, Sarkaari Naukri: Why it’s time to investigate Syed Ali Shah Geelani’s grandson's government job
News_headline: The job was given during the PDP-BJP regime, but now the state is under President’s Rule. It's high time this allocation was investigated and legitimate job seekers are answered.

News_title: Politically Incorrect: In a world of dull, pompous and heavy 'netajis', be a Moon Moon Sen!
News_headline: Moon Moon caused a furor with her 'bed tea' drawl. But then, obviously, we are not used to politicians being honest anymore. Or amusing.

News_title: Democracy's 'Dhartipakad' Davids: Far from celebrity politicians, meet candidates who contested elections all their lives, not to win, but to fight
News_headline: Aside from Arvind Kejriwal, as many as 42 people contested elections against Narendra Modi from Varanasi in 2014, knowing fully well that they would lose. So, why do they fight? What's in it for them?

News_title: Amar Singh: 'Priyanka is definitely better than Rahul Gandhi. But I know the next PM is Modi, Modi and only Modi'
News_headline: Former SP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Amar Singh spoke with Rohit E David about Priyanka versus Rahul Gandhi, how he felt when Jaya Prada faced sexist language and why he feels the next PM is only Narendra Modi.

News_title: Masood Azhar Designated Global Terrorist: Why this is better than sanctions against Hafiz Saeed
News_headline: The world community, including China, recognising Masood Azhar as an international terrorist fixes Pakistan’s responsibility in the Pulwama attack. The move could also boost BJP’s prospects now.

News_title: A Real Indira Gandhi Moment: Priyanka Gandhi snakes her way through Rae Bareli electorate
News_headline: She clearly shares a love for wildlife with her late grandmother. But Priyanka Gandhi must do more to take forward Mrs Indira Gandhi's legacy on this.

News_title: India’s internal jihadist threat is rapidly growing
News_headline: New Delhi’s counterterrorism focus on J&K has allowed jihadists to gain influence in states like Kerala, Tamil Nadu and West Bengal. ISIS has even named a 'Bengal emir'. The situation is fraught and must be controlled.

News_title: Taha Siddiqui: 'India hit JeM in Balakot, forced China to change Masood Azhar stand. Imran Khan's a puppet PM. If Jaish is touched, there'll be a backlash'
News_headline: Taha Siddiqui is an award-winning Pakistani journalist living in Paris, due to a threat to his life in Pakistan. Founder of safenewsrooms.org, Siddiqui spoke with Rohit E David on the Masood Azhar ban, Balakot and if a jihadi backlash may follow now.

News_title: Gadchiroli Maoist attack: This is no intelligence failure. This terrible attack was waiting to happen
News_headline: Retaliatory strikes of this nature are commonplace in the tactics of the Left-wing extremists. But the Gadchiroli attack could have been avoided.

News_title: Sanjay Raut: 'Shiv Sena is a national party now. And we think burqa should be banned in the interests of national security'
News_headline: Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena leader and Rajya Sabha MP, spoke with Rohit E David on why the party wants a burqa ban, Sena-BJP, Hindutva, Marathi manoos and becoming a national party.

News_title: Moon Moon Sen: 'I knew I'd get a Marie Antoinette image after I said 'bed tea'. But I also know Asansol will be won by TMC'
News_headline: Moon Moon Sen of the Trinamool Congress made headlines with her comeback on poll violence in Bengal, claiming her bed tea was late and she was uninformed. Speaking with Rohit E David, Sen discussed tea, TMC and the BJP.

News_title: My 13 Hours with Rahul Gandhi: How the Congress President left an unforgettable impression
News_headline: In an unscheduled night stay in my hometown, Sangamner, Maharashtra, Rahul Gandhi demonstrated great simplicity and deep family values. He left me struck at the modesty of a powerful man.

News_title: Masood Azhar 'Global Terrorist': Does the designation realistically mean anything? And what should India do now?
News_headline: UN has blacklisted the Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) head after China lifted its restrictions on the move. However, what does it actually mean for India?

News_title: No democracy for the poor? Data shows richer candidates have a much higher chance of winning Indian elections
News_headline: BJP is now the richest political party in India. With wealth raining in, often from crony capitalist sources, hidden in schemes like electoral bonds, money is changing our politics for the worse.

News_title: Udit Raj: 'BJP is run by two people, the rest are clerks. The party wants slaves. If you raise your voice, you're attacked'
News_headline: Udit Raj was denied a ticket in the BJP. Soon, he joined the Congress. Raj spoke with Rohit E David on why he left the BJP, joined the Congress and isn't fighting elections there either.

News_title: The Greatest Game-Changer: Why demonetisation was actually one of the best things to happen to India under PM Modi
News_headline: The note ban formalised a huge sector of India's economy, spurred real growth, increased tax compliance, reduced interest rates, curbed artificially high property prices and netted black money. And these are just some massive advantages.

News_title: Why Subhash Bose and Shastri matter: Under Narendra Modi, a veil of mystery obscuring leaders other than the usual kind has finally lifted
News_headline: Suddenly, we see a slew of books and movies probing the lives and deaths of some of our most important, and totally overlooked, leaders. It is only the change in regime which made this possible.

News_title: Bed Tea Vs Bedlam: The importance of being Moon Moon Sen in West Bengal today
News_headline: Even as Asansol, where she's contesting from, saw a minister facing attack, Moon Moon Sen missed the news because she didn't get her bed tea on time. This is exactly why Mamata Banerjee fields her.

News_title: Tanweer Hassan: 'Begusarai is a fight between RJD and BJP. Kanhaiya and his Communists have no vote value here'
News_headline: RJD’s Begusarai candidate Tanweer Hassan has not got enough screen space as the controversial Kanhaiya Kumar or the powerful Giriraj Singh. However, Hassan has ensured his voice is also heard.

News_title: The Real Kashmir: Kulgam goes to the polls, seeking better water and a cleaner district
News_headline: The challenges in Kulgam go beyond the usual narratives of terrorism and strife. But will its political contestants, including PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, drop the hyperbole and look at the water supply?

News_title: Chandra Kumar Bose: 'Mamata Banerjee's TMC has a 'jihadi bahini' to attack opponents. But she's facing a Modi volcano in Bengal now'
News_headline: Chandra Kumar Bose, grandnephew of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, is a BJP leader in West Bengal. Speaking with Rohit E David, Bose discussed the attack on Babul Supriyo, TMC's politics, Netaji and Narendra Modi.

News_title: Et Tu, AAP? Atishi says vote for goons to defeat BJP. Manish Sisodia rakes up her caste. What happened to the party with a difference?
News_headline: If young leaders openly tell people to vote for goons, democracy is indeed threatened. And changed, for the worse.

News_title: What Champagne Socialism?! The Reality of Kanhaiya Kumar's Campaign
News_headline: Those hurling charges of Kanhaiya's supporters being limelight-seekers have missed the real light this campaign has spread.

News_title: Even over Balakot, direct bank transfers are paving the way for PM Modi's return to power
News_headline: Effective monitoring of delivery of welfare schemes, with the help of geo-tagged pictures and Aadhhar data, could propel the BJP back to power.

News_title: Not Only From Sonar Bangla: Why, for the first time in its political history, West Bengal is warming up to a non-Bengali leader
News_headline: The unprecedented popularity of a non-Bengali leader is a clear indication that Bengal is rooting for change. Will it find the answer to its question now in Narendra Modi?

News_title: Maha Trends: Who looks poised to win the 48 Lok Sabha seats in Maharashtra
News_headline: There is palpable anger among Muslim, Dalit and agricultural communities against BJP. But has the Congress capitalised on this? Has the Modi Wave swept again? How is Raj Thackeray impacting the polls?

News_title: Race to the Bottom: How racism infects sport, education, film and everyday life all around us
News_headline: Prejudice is global. India is not immune. But the truth is indisputable. With slavery, colonialism and the treatment of aboriginal people, the West practiced racism on an industrial scale.

News_title: The Maha Turnaround: Decoding a Resurgent Raj Thackeray
News_headline: Despite not fighting these elections, Raj Thackeray has emerged as a huge force in Maharashtra's polls, grabbing public attention and making the BJP nervous. How?

News_title: PR Politics? Why I found PM Modi and movie star Akshay Kumar's interaction so problematic
News_headline: What we needed after the interview was a strict critique and tough counter-questions. What we got instead were headlines speaking of PM Modi’s love for mangoes.

News_title: When Bollywood Meets Politics: A real act begins. But the truth is, our politicians are still the best abhinetas!
News_headline: From Bollywood stars to music celebrities and sports champions, we find a host of vibrant personalities contesting Lok Sabha polls 2019. Are there enough politicians out there?

News_title: Riyaz Deshmukh: 'My late boss Hemant Karkare was a dabangg cop. Speaking against him, Pragya Thakur hurt all police officers in the country'
News_headline: Retired ACP Riyaz Deshmukh had worked with late ATS chief Hemant Karkare. Deeply upset by BJP nominee Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur's recent statements about Karkare, Deshmukh decided to battle her in Bhopal.

News_title: Exclusive PM Narendra Modi Interview: Watch live streaming on Aaj Tak
News_headline: After a grand roadshow in Varanasi, the Prime Minister Narendra Modi sits down with Aaj Tak for a one on one. Here's all you need to know.

News_title: Ajay Rai: 'Congress chose me to fight Narendra Modi in Varanasi. If Priyanka Gandhi had fought, she would have won against him'
News_headline: Ajay Rai is the Congress' pick against BJP's Narendra Modi in Varanasi. In 2014, Rai got 75,000 votes versus Modi's 5.8 lakh. Rai spoke with Rohit E David on PM Modi now, the Varanasi roadshow and why Priyanka Gandhi didn't fight.

News_title: In the heat of electoral battle do not forget Sri Lanka. Terror must be tackled
News_headline: With India in the frenzy of elections, the importance of using pre-emptive foreign policy initiatives to tackle the threat of international terror looms larger than ever in the wake of Sri Lankan terror attacks.

News_title: Soft Coup, Hard Fall in Pakistan: Imran Khan is in total crisis, facing economic and political ruin. Can India exploit the situation?
News_headline: The first cabinet reshuffle is intimation of the govt's impending demise. The army has taken back control of vital portfolios. They will find a new puppet PM. Till then, Imran Khan's options are severely limited.

News_title: Priyanka Gandhi was the Congress' brahmastra but has the party misfired it?
News_headline: Despite the hype, Priyanka Gandhi did not even get to speak on her debut day. As rumours grow of her brother Rahul's coterie fearing her impact, Priyanka's no-show from Varanasi now adds to the flavour of a flop.

News_title: Will the young Turks please stand up: How many youth netas around us truly qualify for that over-used epithet?
News_headline: We see the term “young Turks” used a lot whenever some relatively younger leader comes to centre-stage, but what does it even mean? And why do most actually not make the cut?

News_title: PM Modi roadshow in Varanasi: Watch live coverage on Aaj Tak
News_headline: Accompanying the Prime Minister on this grand show of strength and popularity are BJP stalwarts Sushma Swaraj, Nirmala Sitharaman, Nitin Gadkari and Piyush Goyal.

News_title: AAP has delivered on mohalla clinics. But to deliver true world-class facilities, Delhi needs full statehood
News_headline: The Arvind Kejriwal government has tried hard but the way the system is drawn up, conflicts with the centre hold up development work. It is important to ensure Delhi finally has full administrative rights.

News_title: PM Modi in Varanasi: Priyanka Gandhi conspicuous by absence. Her not contesting against Modi in Varanasi shows Congress is not serious
News_headline: The worst that could have happened with Priyanka contesting against Modi is that she would have lost. But it would have conveyed Congress means business in UP.

News_title: Finally, dignity of trade: Why Akhilesh Yadav’s 'doodhwala' vs Modi’s 'chaiwala' rhetoric offers hope in a post-Hindu caste world
News_headline: Tejaswi Yadav calling Modi 'nakli OBC' and Akhilesh calling himself a real 'doodhwala' shows India is finally shaking off the shame associated with caste and talking about the nobility of labour.

News_title: Shalini Yadav: 'PM Modi should lose in Varanasi. It's overflowing with garbage, people don't even have drinking water'
News_headline: Shalini Yadav will contest in Varanasi against PM Modi for the Samajwadi Party (SP). Speaking with Rohit E David, she discussed Varanasi and how only the 'gathbandhan' is giving the BJP a tough fight, the Congress having failed completely.

News_title: War, peace and IPL: What my meeting with Rula Ghani, the First Lady of Afghanistan, was made of
News_headline: Rula Ghani says she does things differently, in her own way. A tête-à-tête later, we wouldn't disagree.

News_title: Narendra Modi in Benaras: Why it is likely that for a change, the Prime Minister will include and name his regional allies in his Varanasi show
News_headline: The BJP will need to overcome the sheer arithmetical superiority of the grand alliance in more seats in Uttar Pradesh. And it will have to assuage allies who feel the party is a one-man show.

News_title: Atishi: 'BJP is not coming back to power. There will be a coalition and AAP will support any govt that gives Delhi full statehood'
News_headline: Atishi is an Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader standing for elections in Delhi. Atishi spoke with Rohit E David about why AAP and Congress broke up before starting, the cult of Arvind Kejriwal and the appeal of PM Modi.

News_title: Making Hate So Normal: The BJP fielding Pragya Thakur is an attempt to mainstream terror accused persons. Our silence is criminal
News_headline: Why does the switching of a spokesperson from Congress to Shiv Sena get more attention than the implications of the BJP fielding Sadhvi Pragya from Bhopal? The answer to this should disturb us all.

News_title: When Modi Met Akshay: Why the ‘chat show’ is such a positive PR exercise for PM Modi
News_headline: It's not every day a famous film star interviews the Prime Minister of India. Akshay Kumar's interview of PM Modi presents the PM not as a hardened political warrior but a man with a softer side.

News_title: 'No If, No But, Only Jatt': But will the Jat plus glamour mix of stars Dharmendra and Hema Malini actually help Sunny Deol in politics?
News_headline: Dharmendra and Hema Malini have each had starry but stormy political innings thus far. As Sunny Deol now enters the raajneetik fray, will he call upon their appeal or go it his way?

News_title: SC raps Rahul: Why the ‘Chowkidar Chor Hai’ jibe shows Rahul Gandhi's fatigue and the Congress' fear of loss
News_headline: With NYAY failing to gather steam, the Rafale accusations not denting Modi’s image and the ire of the apex court now, Rahul Gandhi’s desperation is clear.

News_title: Why Sunny Deol is the perfect fit for the BJP
News_headline: From hypermasculinity to nationalism, there is not one BJP theme that Sunny Paaji hasn’t already evoked through his films.

News_title: 'Pakistan's Pappu': Why Pak PM Imran Khan is being referred to with a new title
News_headline: Imran Khan's geography is bad. Really bad. But is it so bad that he can't figure where Pakistan is going?

News_title: Krishna Poonia, Congress candidate, Jaipur Rural, says Rajyavardhan Rathore failed sports fraternity, BJP uses gau raksha to cover its failures
News_headline: The first Indian woman to win a gold in CWG track and field event says she is unfazed by Narendra Modi campaigning for Rathore.

News_title: Priyanka Chaturvedi: 'Congress speaks of ideological change. But it uses Raj Thackeray. Doesn’t it show lack of leadership?'
News_headline: Priyanka Chaturvedi left the Congress and joined the Shiv Sena last week. She spoke with Rohit E David on what she faced in the Congress, going from a national to a regional party and why she thinks this is Shiv Sena 2.0.

News_title: Battle for Gujarat: Why his home state will be a litmus test for Narendra Modi’s popularity
News_headline: While the BJP has a huge advantage in Gujarat, namely, Narendra Modi, the Congress is confident of winning seats after its improved performance in the 2017 Assembly polls.

News_title: Arif Mohammad Khan: 'After politics, people will see the importance of Triple Talak Law and thank Modi for it, Nehru too would be pleased with Modi'
News_headline: Arif Mohammed Khan, former Union Minister in Rajiv Gandhi's govt, who famously resigned at the overturning of the Shah Bano judgment, spoke with Rohit E David about the triple talak law, Narendra Modi and 'secular' vs 'communal' parties.

News_title: Vijender Singh: 'Narendra Modi said he'd fight black money. But his govt's Rs 2000 note made it easy to carry black money!'
News_headline: Boxer Vijender Singh has joined the Congress party and will fight Lok Sabha polls on May 12 from South Delhi. Singh spoke with Rohit E David on why the Congress, his views on AAP and BJP, and whether he'll continue boxing.

News_title: How low can they go? Elections 2019 is seeing our politicians only fall lower and lower in mudslinging and maligning
News_headline: The extent to which Indian politicians stoop to name calling and launching verbal attacks that are personal in nature is revolting. If this is the new normal, this is something we need to worry about.

News_title: The Karmic Cycle: Did LK Advani's karma boomerang and lead to his sidelining in the BJP?
News_headline: There are many who say that Advani’s was a "gentler kind of communalism" and he is appalled by what the BJP has now become. That is absolute nonsense.

News_title: As The Belt Tightens: China’s Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) is only generating resentment in Pakistan. Particularly among the volatile Baloch
News_headline: Even as Imran Khan visits China, the Chinese are concerned about their workers in Pakistan. They face pressure from the people of Balochistan, enraged at the misuse of their resources and the abuse of their human rights.

News_title: Kitne Rahul hain? ‘Rahul Gandhi’ candidates galore in Wayanad!
News_headline: The Congress president isn’t the only Rahul Gandhi contesting from the rural district in Kerala.

News_title: Sri Lanka’s Islamist nightmare: Why the investigation is being closely watched by India and Maldives
News_headline: The ISIS aims to heighten religious tensions through mass casualty attacks on places of worship. Sri Lanka has so far not focused intensively on ISIS recruits and splinter groups. That will change.

News_title: No More Tears: Mayawati and Mulayam Singh bury their grudges. The national parties have much to worry about
News_headline: Despite an extremely bitter and fractious past, Mayawati and Mulayam Singh's rapprochement holds nothing but dread for the Congress and BJP.

News_title: Why India has to bite the Universal Basic Income bullet
News_headline: A direct cash transfer to the poor is a powerful idea, and whichever political party comes to power at the Centre will feel compelled to move towards it in order to repair India's broken fiscal engine.

News_title: Major General GD Bakshi (retd): 'Is it wrong to honour India's old soldiers? I wish Vistara hadn't buckled under army-hating voices'
News_headline: Major General GD Bakshi (retired) spoke with Rohit E David on the Vistara row and the airline deleting the tweet honouring, Balakot and, punishing Pakistan, General Hooda, and whether he'll still fly Vistara.

News_title: Dynasty Vs Democracy: How feudal political families have ruined India's governance and representation
News_headline: So feudal is our politics now, even single politicians like Mamata Banerjee and Mayawati have 'heirs'. This has ruined inner-party democracy and lowered standards of national governance too.

News_title: Shashi Tharoor's 'Thulabharam Mindset': Why I see Tharoor as a staunch Hindu revivalist who will likely join BJP/RSS soon
News_headline: With his support to Sabarimala traditionalists, his book 'Why I Am A Hindu' and now, his thulabharam practice, Shashi Tharoor has shown his Hindutva colours. His transit seems simply a matter of time.

News_title: Yes, Minister: The NDA has a true asset in Sushma Swaraj, external affairs minister. If it returns, it must retain her
News_headline: As multiple explosions rocked Sri Lanka, Sushma Swaraj offered help, information and reassurance to Indian citizens. This is only one instance of Sushma rising to the occasion and coming to the aid of fellow Indians.

News_title: Lord Meghnad Desai: 'India has got rising growth, falling inflation of a kind not seen before. It's absurd to claim an unemployment crisis as well'
News_headline: Lord Meghnad Desai, renowned economist and Member, House of Lords, UK, spoke with Rohit E David about India's economy, Narendra Modi's moves, demonetisation and Vijay Mallya.

News_title: Bengal's Deadly Dadagiri: How criminal bullying, extortion and vote capturing has become an intrinsic part of Bengal's culture
News_headline: If CPM is to be blamed for the rise of local dadas, then Trinamul should be held responsible for perpetuating the legacy. Bengal's bhadralok are afraid to even talk about the dadagiri which is destroying Tagore's state.

News_title: Sadhvi Pragya has a right to be nominated. And the electorate should defeat her. But it won’t happen
News_headline: Liberals demanding that persons like the Sadhvi, accused of terrorism, be debarred from contesting elections are missing the point. Entirely.

News_title: 'My torture,' 'my curse', 'Hemant Karkare's karma': Is Pragya Thakur accusing a hero of the country to rile up emotions in this polarised poll?
News_headline: Action against 'torture' should be taken. But will accusing a dead man serve any purpose legally?

News_title: Can the Election Commission play a good referee and ensure a good match...err, poll?
News_headline: It is natural for political parties to try and bend the rules as far as possible. Even a little headstart is a big advantage. EC's role as the 'referee,' therefore, is a very important one.

News_title: Poonam Sinha: 'Rajnath Singh has not done any work in Lucknow over the last five years. Everywhere I go, people are praising Akhilesh Yadav'
News_headline: Poonam Sinha, wife of actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha, is contesting from SP against Home Minister Rajnath Singh in Lucknow. She spoke with Rohit E David about her chances, Singh's record and why she didn't join the Congress.

News_title: Mainpuri Ki Main: In Muyalam Singh's bastion, Mayawati underlined she is the queen
News_headline: Mulayam Singh Yadav asked SP workers to show respect to Mayawati. Akhilesh Yadav said the SP will never forget her favours. Mayawati reigned supreme over a political present which includes the dreadful 'Guest House incident' past.

News_title: No, Minister, No: What Maneka Gandhi and Amit Shah too must be reminded about the Indian Constitution
News_headline: Opposition leaders should call out both leaders' statements and reassure anxious voters that it's not so easy to just take away people’s rights.

News_title: Why Priyanka Chaturvedi and Shaina NC speaking out against their own parties must be carefully heard
News_headline: Both women need to be commended not just for speaking out against the wrongs in their respective parties, but also speaking up for themselves.

News_title: How Tamil Nadu became India's politics' most booty-full state
News_headline: The raids and the hauls in Tamil Nadu that caused eyeballs to pop and jaws to drop across the country.

News_title: Priyanka Chaturvedi Quits Congress: And joins the Shiv Sena. Why I think this is just politics, and far from feminism
News_headline: Priyanka Chaturvedi's timing just doesn’t add up with the narrative. If you are deeply upset with your party's treatment of you, you can always leave. But joining a rival party so swiftly shows more afoot.

News_title: Dimple Yadav's Shocker: Why leaders like the Samajwadi Party bahu Dimple in fact power Azam Khan's unabated misogyny
News_headline: No, Dimple. Azam Khan's comments cannot be whitewashed in whataboutery. There is a time women leaders have to stand up for women. You just missed that crucial occasion.

News_title: Nisar Ahmed Bilal: 'My son, just 20, died in Malegaon's blast. My entire area is angry at Sadhvi Pragya contesting. I've appealed. I'm not afraid of anyone now'
News_headline: Nisar Ahmed Sayyed Bilal lost his son, Sayyed Azhar Nisar Ahmed, 20, in the Malegaon blast on September 29, 2008. Bilal spoke to Rohit E David on his application, seeking a bar on Sadhvi Pragya, the blast accused, contesting the Lok Sabha poll.

News_title: India's Most Famous Saas-Bahu Saga: Why Indira Gandhi's household produced eternal bitterness between her daughters-in-law
News_headline: As Maneka and Sonia Gandhi hit the headlines for their political moves, a look back at when the two women were just daughters-in-law to PM Indira Gandhi, in whose home a relationship of bickering and an eventual break in embittered ties began.

News_title: Pakistan had no intel about Balakot: How Pakistan is now amping up its surveillance
News_headline: The strength of IAF and PAF can't be compared. But China's co-operation in upgrading JK-17 — a kind-of hybrid of MiG21 and F-16 — is significant.

News_title: Sushil Modi: 'Excellent that Shatrughan Sinha's no longer in BJP. Without BJP, what existence does he have? Kanhaiya's also a media creation'
News_headline: Bihar’s deputy chief minister Sushil Kumar Modi spoke with Rohit E David on Shatrughan Sinha, Tej Pratap vs Tejashwi Yadav, why he feels the mahagathbandhan is falling apart, and suing Rahul Gandhi.

News_title: Shazia Ilmi: 'The BJP is absolutely right in giving Sadhvi Pragya a ticket. She has been a victim, tortured and paralysed'
News_headline: Delhi BJP vice-president Shazia Ilmi spoke with Rohit E David on a shoe being thrown in a BJP press conference, Sadhvi Pragya Thakur being given a ticket, Muslim appeasement politics and the possible alliance between Congress and AAP.

News_title: Khushbu Sundar: 'Narendra Modi has no appeal in Tamil Nadu. Every time he visits, 'Go Back Modi' trends'! Congress-DMK will win 35 of 39 seats'
News_headline: Congress leader and actor-turned-politician Khushbu Sundar spoke with Rohit E David on the 'hasty decision' to cancel the Vellore election, the BJP's appeal in Tamil politics and Tamil leaders, from Kamal Hassan to Stalin.

News_title: No, there is no Modi wave. Nor a Hindutva frenzy in UP
News_headline: Early in the elections, Uttar Pradesh has mirrored many paradoxes. Modi has superstar status. That might not get him votes. The BJP has built a non-Yadav, non-Jat voter base. But many could swing back to familiar caste and community voting patterns.

News_title: Why Kanhaiya Kumar's battle in Begusarai represents a strong new hope for Indian politics
News_headline: Caught between communalists and criminals, Begusarai sees more than a single ray of light in these student leaders.

News_title: Vellore Cancelled: Lok Sabha election in Tamil Nadu’s Vellore cancelled after cash seizure
News_headline: While this is the first time a Lok Sabha poll has been cancelled on account of cash seizures, Tamil Nadu has often seen Assembly polls cancelled on the same charge.

News_title: Convenient Secularists: How those who called Vajpayee 'communal' first later hailed him as a 'statesman'
News_headline: Political narratives are all about convenience. You are 'secular' when you talk of caste groups or the Muslim-Yadav combination. But you are 'communal' when you speak of the Hindu vote bank. What drives such selective standards?

News_title: Lok Sabha elections 2019: How politics is in a populist trap
News_headline: Both Congress and BJP wish to be seen rather similarly - as populist, welfare-statist, inclusive and nationalist.

News_title: Lok Sabha Phase II: Voting to be held for 97 seats. And a big day for Tamil Nadu
News_headline: While voting in Tamil Nadu will be held for 38 Lok Sabha seats, by-polls to 18 Assembly seats would also be held. In addition, several other states will also go to the polls today.

News_title: Electoral Bonds and Black Money: Living in denial about how our polls are, and were, funded isn't solving much. It's mirroring the frustrations of a few
News_headline: Current criticism of electoral bonds seems fuelled by most funding going to the BJP. But for a better system, the attempt should be to improve bonds through dialogue, not junk this lock, stock and barrel.

News_title: Lok Sabha Elections 2019: 10 seats with the most nail-biting contests!
News_headline: As people vote to elect 543 representatives for the 17th Lok Sabha, here is a list of 10 seats that offer the most interesting fights.

News_title: Yes, there is a Pakistan hand: What Pak did on the eve of the first day of Indian elections
News_headline: Three things Pakistan did just before the first phase of Indian elections. The move was clearly meant to have an impact on voters.

News_title: Strangely weak EC? Why does the Election Commission need a rap on its knuckles from the SC to do its job?
News_headline: It's been facing charges of acting slowly against some offenders, and not acting against others at all. The EC must assert itself strongly now, to provide a level field to all candidates and regain the trust of voters.

News_title: Sam Pitroda: 'What proof does India have of Balakot air-strike? I have the right to ask. What the PM says about me is shameful and cheap'
News_headline: Congress leader and famed technocrat Sam Pitroda spoke with Rohit E David about why he still questions the Balakot air-strike, why PM Modi shares certain similarities to President Trump and his prediction for Elections 2019.

News_title: There's nothing like Home: Why veteran BJP leader Rajnath Singh poses a formidable challenge to Lok Sabha opponents in Lucknow
News_headline: Rajnath Singh stands out in political life for a sober image and dignified words. His electoral appeal is strong enough in his home turf to make finding his challenger a challenge.

News_title: Democracy, in the dark: Blind voters are left at the mercy of attendants; say not all EVMs are Braille-enabled
News_headline: With elections on, blind and visually impaired voters say not all have received Braille-enabled voter ID cards, nor are most EVMs Braille-friendly. Sometimes, they don't even know who their helper presses their vote for.

News_title: Pakistan's PJ: Saudi Crown Prince MBS awarded for ‘humanitarian action’. Irony is dead. (Like Jamal Khashoggi)
News_headline: It doesn't get funnier than this. A prize for 'humanitarian action'. Given to the Saudi crown prince. And bestowed by Pakistan.

News_title: Pakistan's Barbaric Cruelty: Several captive pigeons burnt alive, simply for losing a race in Faisalabad
News_headline: Pakistanis use pigeons for racing and breeding. You would think the pigeons, being a ticket to get rich quick, would at least be treated well. This is not so. In Pakistan's Punjab, a cage-full was recently burnt alive.

News_title: Annul Article 35A: This Article has crushed economic development, and a lot more, in Jammu and Kashmir
News_headline: The basis of Article 35A and Article 370 is to protect J&K’s demography. But from what? The rest of India? From non-Muslims? 35A is based purely on discrimination. Imagine if such an Act existed in the rest of the country.

News_title: No, Home Minister: Why Rajnath Singh's promise of BJP strengthening sedition law instantly reminds me of Jallianwala Bagh
News_headline: Rajnath Singh says the BJP would strengthen sedition law against 'anti-nationals'. The Congress has promised to end the same law. These are two completely different ideas of India and our freedom.

News_title: Time for NRC in Bengal: Illegal Bangladeshi immigrants are pouring into India from porous Bengal borders, endangering natives and their property
News_headline: Illegal infiltration from Bangladesh into West Bengal has only multiplied over the years. Today, jihadi elements have also entered the routes. It's time for India to put our own security first.

News_title: 5 faults in Maneka Gandhi’s ABCD grading system
News_headline: Like Indian parents, Maneka, too, couldn't keep this a secret. Everyone in India has to know the actual marks her 'grades' stand for. And to diss it.

News_title: Azam Khan is assaulting Jaya Prada through his speeches. EC should ban him from contesting in Rampur
News_headline: Over the past many years, Khan has lost no opportunity to attack Jaya Prada by hitting her with gender-specific insults. This is far from the level playing field every candidate must have.

News_title: Kashmir's Silence Over Rape: Why is Kashmir so quiet over the horrific Bandipora incest-rape-suicide case?
News_headline: Although gruesome incidents of sexual assault shake the Valley, they are downplayed in Kashmir's political and media circles. The only narrative that seems to matter is the “Kashmir cause”. Even incest and rape get buried under that.

News_title: Waheed-ur-Rehman Para: 'BJP is ruining democracy in Kashmir. It's now backing Sajad Lone. Congress was far better'
News_headline: Waheed-ur-Rehman Para is youth president and spokesperson of the Jammu and Kashmir Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Speaking with Rohit E David, Para discussed Imran Khan, Narendra Modi and Sajad Lone.

News_title: Between the Lines: Why do some Wahhabis want the Ayodhya temple for Lord Ram?
News_headline: Wahhabi preacher Salman Nadwi and others like him support the temple for Ram as a strategic retreat, citing the historical Treaty of Hudaybiyyah. But what exactly is this treaty?

News_title: Milind Deora: 'The Shiv Sena-BJP's opportunistic alliance has in fact aided the Congress' comeback in Maharashtra'
News_headline: Milind Deora has taken over the Mumbai Regional Congress Committee chief, replacing Sanjay Nirupam recently. Deora spoke with Rohit E David about the Congress' chances in Maharashtra, politics within the party and the issues of this election.

News_title: Who is afraid of transparency in the functioning of our political parties?
News_headline: The Centre is apparently not only opposed to transparency in political funding, it is also opposed to bringing political parties under the RTI Act. In the latter, all major political parties are united.

News_title: Priya Dutt: 'Shiv Sena has been disrespected many times in the last five years. MNS will support Congress in this election'
News_headline: Former Mumbai MP Priya Dutt will contest the General Elections 2019. Speaking with Rohit E David, Dutt explained her return to politics, the Congress' chances in Maharashtra, roping in Raj Thackeray and her brother Sanjay Dutt.

News_title: Imran wants Modi back in power - seriously?
News_headline: It is amusing to see the secular parties taking a cue from the Pak PM to bash an Indian PM who flaunts his nationalistic credentials rather openly.

News_title: Brutal honesty: Maneka Gandhi says she won’t work for Muslims if they don’t give her votes. She just broke the hypocrisy mould!
News_headline: Maneka Gandhi says we can't be expected to behave like Mahatma Gandhi. Is she India's first politician to admit politics is a transaction, plain and simple, and there is no emotional idealism involved?

News_title: Lt Gen ML Naidu: 'Politicised forces can swing any way. I completely endorse every word in the letter sent to the President'
News_headline: Former Army vice chief Lt General ML Naidu spoke with Rohit E David about the controversial letter to the President by armed forces veterans on the 'politicisation of the forces'. Some veterans have outright rejected signing such a letter.

News_title: Truth in a 'sealed cover'? SC says political parties must submit details of electoral bonds to the EC, but adds a crucial caveat
News_headline: Attorney General KK Venugopal asked why citizens should know where the money of political parties is coming from. Can citizens now ask why politicians should know where their money is coming from?

News_title: 2019 Elections: Can the BJP pull off a Tripura in Odisha polls?
News_headline: This article has been co-authored by Niranjan Sahoo, senior fellow, Observer Research Foundation, and Anshuman Behera, assistant professor at National Institute of Advanced Studies, Bangalore.

News_title: Between the Lines: How the BJP and Congress manifestos hold up on national security
News_headline: The BJP scores over the Congress due to a clear stand on issues of nationalism and internal security. But both parties flounder on other crucial issues.

News_title: Lok Sabha 2019: BJP President promises politics of exclusion. Why we must worry
News_headline: Amit Shah reportedly promises to remove every single 'infiltrator' from India. But the sections he includes under 'infiltrators' is not very helpful to the secularism of this country.

News_title: Why Pakistan is waiting and watching India: Pak airspace is still not fully opened. What are they afraid of?
News_headline: Pakistan extending a general closure notice for transit flights till April 24 is significant. By that time, India will complete three phases of the Lok Sabha Elections.

News_title: Poll officers: 'We must digitalise the electoral list. This process takes ages and people get angry with us'
News_headline: The process of checking list needs to be simplified as it takes time to locate a person's credentials on the list. Often, if a poll officer can't find a name, a potential voter flares up.

News_title: The Great Andhra Battle: Will Jaganmohan indeed emerge as darling of the masses and AP's new CM?
News_headline: Having witnessed high-voltage campaigns and vivid drama, and after casting their vote through a violent polling day, the Telugu states will be in some political lull for the next 42 days.

News_title: Poll Police: 'Low rank cops are told to stand in the sun for hours. Our duty is such, we can't even take loo breaks'
News_headline: These police officers have to stand for more than 18 hours on a poll day, till the EVMs reach the polling centre. Away from their homes for a month, they wish for fresh cooked food. And some shade.

News_title: Nehru wouldn't allow it: What Narendra Modi’s hurry for a biopic on him says to me about his leadership
News_headline: Is it right for the RSS to allow such massive personal glorification? Or ethical for a PM to want such a biopic while he's still in office and indeed, facing re-election?

News_title: Meet Khush Nath, Voter of 90 Years: "I have voted in every poll since 1947. I prefer ballot paper to EVM. At least I knew who got my vote''
News_headline: Khush Nath has never missed an opportunity to vote. After 1947, he started by voting for Jawaharlal Nehru 'and whoever would give my village a samosa'. Today, he's using EVM machines.

News_title: Lok Sabha 2019: Why does Election Commission look weak in ensuring a level playing field?
News_headline: Delayed or mild action in some alleged violations of the code of conduct, and no action at all in others, are allowing space for misuse of official machinery and vitiation of fair play.

News_title: Mob lynching is done by all those people who support Narendra Modi: Asaduddin Owaisi
News_headline: Owaisi says that, "If one community is being deliberately targeted, discriminated and mob lynching incidents happen then it is a threat to the whole country."

News_title: Sajad Lone: 'When people like Omar Abdullah talk about the rights of Kashmiris, it only trivialises the issue'
News_headline: Sajad Gani Lone, Chairman, Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference, spoke with Rohit E David on the BJP and Article 370 and 35A, the Congress and AFSPA, talks with Pakistan and talks by Omar Abdullah.

News_title: Saharanpur Votes: What the Muslim-dominated UP constituency holds for BJP, Congress and SP-BSP
News_headline: The contest here is significant because it is split three strong ways.

News_title: Lok Sabha Elections 2019: Voting starts slow across India. Should NDA be smiling?
News_headline: Voting is underway in 91 Lok Sabha seats spread across 20 states and two union territories in the first phase. Does slow voter turnout indicate advantage NDA?

News_title: Last man standing for India's Muslims? Asaduddin Owaisi opens up on his background, his politics and his sherwani
News_headline: Asaduddin Owaisi is arguably the most forceful and significant Indian Muslim voice today.

News_title: My message to first time voters: Choose love, not hate
News_headline: Narendra Modi has painted the choices of this election in the starkest possible terms. But in fact, you need to know the history of India and its political diversity to make the best possible choice.

News_title: Shatrughan Sinha: 'I saw BJP turning into a one-man show and a two-man army. They kept threatening to expel me'
News_headline: Having joined the Congress after decades in the BJP, the flamboyant Shatrughan Sinha spoke with Rohit E David on why he switched, movie stars in politics and whether, after his Advani years, he's 'secular' now.

News_title: Lalu Yadav's thoughts from 'Gopalganj to Raisina': What Lalu Yadav’s memoir reveals about his life and politics
News_headline: Lalu claims he's inspired by the greatest crusaders of time, including Mahatma Gandhi and Martin Luther King Jr. He also claims that despite RSS and Sangh Parivaar's oppression, his spirit remains fighting fit.

News_title: His Wrath Yatra: Why liberal whitewashing of LK Advani today doesn't impress me at all
News_headline: Liberals are suddenly tearing up for LK Advani. Their lamentation shows how hollow and hypocritical they are, for Advani started it all.

News_title: PM Modi Biopic: Will the controversial film also resurrect Vivek Oberoi's Bollywood career?
News_headline: From a promising career in 2002 to no Bollywood hits since 2013, Vivek Oberoi's career has been going steadily downhill. A lot more than politics thus rides on his latest movie

News_title: 2019 Lok Sabha elections: How political parties are whipping up separatist sentiments in Kashmir
News_headline: Facing internal rivals and external pressures, the politicians of the Valley are stoking separatist feelings, uncaring of how this will impact life post-elections in Kashmir.

News_title: Narendra Modi’s chances of getting a second term: Here’s what the numbers say
News_headline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s popularity has rebounded in states where the BJP lost to the Congress less than half a year ago.

News_title: Bishada, Dadri: 'What Mohd Akhlaq did was wrong. The decision of the mob was right'
News_headline: Narendra Modi's tenure began with the shadow of Mohd Akhlaq's lynching in Dadri. Today, villagers of Bishada, Dadri, say Akhlaq lived like them, but his alleged act towards a cow was 'unforgivable'.

News_title: Part II. NYAY complements PM-KISAN in fighting poverty and inequality
News_headline: Global thinking has changed with increasing acceptance of income transfer initiatives like NYAY and PM-KISAN to fight poverty and inequality. This part of the series focuses on the UN and India’s fight against hunger and inequality.

News_title: When statues are vandalised:  It is not opposition to a thought process. It is the savagery of action that is the worrying part
News_headline: From Periyar to Ambedkar, Mahatma Gandhi to Rajiv Gandhi, vandalising statues has become the new normal. Does this represent an intellectual anger? Or something far more sinister?

News_title: Political Khichdi: Why the regional mix-rice dish is the hot favourite this election season!
News_headline: Like politics, khichdi varies from region to region. Here is a peek into the regional platter that is going to be offered to the Indian public this poll season.

News_title: Why so Sati Savitri? Making our female netas switch from jeans and skirts to plainest sarees is sheer hypocrisy!
News_headline: Whether it's female film stars or a celeb neta like Priyanka Gandhi, we are scared of strong women who challenge stereotypes. Isn't that why we force female netas into only 'decent Indian clothing'?

News_title: BJP Manifesto Decoded: How the document mirrors Narendra Modi is calm about his achievements, sincere about his commitments
News_headline: The BJP manifesto maps out a confident route for the future. It doesn't fall for the Congress manifesto's welfare populism. But it does up the ante on nationalism and security.

News_title: English Medium in Andhra: How Jagan Mohan Reddy’s promise can catapult him to the CM’s chair
News_headline: The elite have long denied rural children the right to quality education, which will make them eligible for jobs not just in India but world over. Jagan Reddy could now change that, and ignite new dreams.

News_title: Repealing AFSPA: Political expediency will harm military operations and help militants
News_headline: The Congress Party’s election manifesto suggests reviewing AFSPA. However, playing politics over this essential security act is only playing into the hands of insurgents who wish to harm India.

News_title: When Basanti came to Mathura: Why Hema Malini is the only (dark) humour in this election!
News_headline: Basanti's Dhanno now ranges from her black Mercedes to a private chopper to a photo-op on a tractor reportedly with battery-operated fans. What is not to like?

News_title: 'Lakshmi’s NTR' may not swing an election, but it will alter opinions ahead of Andhra polls
News_headline: Ramgopal Verma's biopic of N T Rama Rao, from the perspective of his second wife and Chandrababu Naidu's rival, Lakshmi Parvathy, is politically explosive. It awaits release in Andhra, perhaps due to its volatile depictions.

News_title: Modi's Hard-Hitting Appeal: What happened at Balakot, Pakistan will decisively impact India's polls
